;如果您乘坐巴士前往内罗毕机场，可能是电动巴士 -动力一辆 - 可能是由一家中国公司制造的。

;

;随着肯尼亚在道路交通脱碳方面迈出一小步，在肯尼亚首都运营的几家巴士公司现在在其车队中配备了电动汽车。

;

;肯尼亚电动汽车公司 BasiGo 是供应公交车的公司之一，与中国最大的电动汽车制造商比亚迪合作。

;

;迄今为止，该公司已向内罗毕的客户交付了 19 辆比亚迪 K6 电动公交车，并安装了首批 3 辆 DC BasiGo 联合创始人兼首席执行官吉特·巴塔查亚 (Jit Bhattacharya) 表示，该公司已在该市公交路线沿线建立了快速充电站。

;

;“BasiGo 已收到内罗毕公交运营商的 130 多辆电动公交车预订，他们迫切希望”他说。

;

;这些公交车进口到肯尼亚，部分由比亚迪汽车在中国组装，并在蒙巴萨的联合车辆组装厂完成，并将开始全面组装比亚迪电动汽车今年晚些时候将推出公交车。

;

;BasiGo 并不是唯一参与肯尼亚公共交通电气化竞赛的公司。瑞典-肯尼亚电动汽车公司 Roam 也在内罗毕推出电动巴士和摩托车。 7 月，该公司在该市开设了一家装配厂，每年生产 50,000 辆电动摩托车。

;

;中国公司引领全球汽车市场的电气化之旅：穆塔雷斯

;

;但在整个非洲，与欧洲和美国相比，由于成本和缺乏足够的电力供应，电动汽车的数量仍然较低。

;

;尽管如此，比亚迪、吉利、东风汽车、长城汽车等中国电动汽车制造商，上汽集团、哈弗集团和江淮汽车正在非洲扩张。他们在南非、卢旺达、埃及、埃塞俄比亚、卢旺达、津巴布韦、加纳、摩洛哥和尼日利亚等市场销售车辆。

;

;比亚迪于 6 月在南非推出首款电动 SUV Atto 3其中东和非洲销售总经理 Ad Huang 强调了公司的绿色资质。

;

;“我们正在抵消近 350 亿公斤的碳排放。这一里程碑相当于在我们的星球上种植了近6亿棵树。”黄说。

;

;这是继长城欧拉之后今年第二款进入南非市场的中国电动汽车，其售价约为美国38,500 美元至 49,200 美元。 Atto 3 的售价约为 41,260 美元至 44,860 美元。梅赛德斯-奔驰、宝马和奥迪的高端车型起价远超过 53,720 美元，这对于大多数南非人来说是遥不可及的。

;

;非洲气候基金会执行董事萨利姆·法基尔 (Saliem Fakir) 表示，尽管中国汽车在南非汽车市场中占据主导地位，大多数非洲市场由于缺乏可靠的电力以及与电动汽车相关的其他障碍，电动汽车的采用率较低。

;

;他举了南非的例子，估计那里有 1200 万辆汽车在路上行驶其中只有 1,000 多辆是电动汽车。

;

;但他表示，开普敦和尼日利亚等电动公交车举措正在产生影响，而中国的电动公交车大部分是在公共交通领域作为公司Fakir 表示，“尽管电动汽车有很多好处，但缺乏充电基础设施和充足可靠的电力是许多消费者转向电动汽车的主要障碍。” >;他还指出肯尼亚和卢旺达电动自行车的增长，这些电动自行车由中国公司供应并在这两个非洲国家组装。

;

;中国电池公司发现韩国的漏洞以规避美国的补贴规则

;

;标准普尔全球移动公司欧洲、中东和非洲汽车预测首席分析师沃尔特·马德拉 (Walt Madeira) 表示，中国品牌正在以更低的成本为电动汽车买家提供更多选择。

;

;但他表示价格主流汽车购买者接受电动汽车的理想价格需要低于 500,000 兰特（26,860 美元），因此他预计“短期内需求有限”。

;

;他表示，长城汽车、哈弗等中国公司奇瑞将推出更多价格实惠、配备汽油和混合动力系统的车型。

;

;在南非，威特沃特斯兰德大学南方不平等研究中心的客座研究员 Alex Mohubetswane Mashilo 表示2017 年至 2022 年期间，仅售出 532 辆插电式混合动力电动汽车。同期售出约 5,250 辆混合动力汽车和 1,092 辆电池电动汽车。

;

;Mashilo 将销量低归因于价格和电力短缺，并指出电动汽车在中国比南非“便宜得多”。

;

;他表示，南非的电力公司正在“减载”——通过切断对某些客户的供应来减少消耗——因为没有足够的电力来满足电力需求。满足需求。

;

;此外，与中国不同，“南非根本没有电动汽车充电基础设施。这意味着只有那些能够负担得起电动汽车高成本的人......[和]电力并且确实想要电动汽车才是他们的市场”，Mashilo 说。

;

;“鉴于中国汽车品牌在南方的价格相对较低与欧洲和美国品牌相比，非洲品牌未来有机会占据领先地位。”他补充道。

;

;俄罗斯外交部誓言将对克里米亚大桥发生的所谓“恐怖袭击”进行报复，莫斯科于 2014 年从乌克兰强行吞并。

;

;俄罗斯国防部表示，乌克兰曾试图用 S-200 火箭弹袭击刻赤海峡大桥，但未成功，迫使其暂时关闭。周六下午的新袭击再次导致大桥关闭。

;

;这座连接俄罗斯吞并的克里米亚和俄罗斯的 19 公里大桥自莫斯科对乌克兰发动全面入侵以来，多次遭到乌克兰军队的袭击2022年2月24日。

;

;“乌克兰导弹被及时发现，并被俄罗斯防空系统在空中拦截。国防部表示，没有造成任何损失或人员伤亡的报道。

;

;俄罗斯驻克里米亚州长谢尔盖·阿克肖诺夫 (Sergei Aksyonov) 早些时候在 Telegram 消息应用程序上发布的一份声明中表示，两枚火箭弹被附近的防空防御系统击落。桥。他还说桥梁没有损坏。

;

;阿克肖诺夫后来报告说，桥梁遭受了第三次火箭袭击，但没有成功。

;

;“感谢我们防空部队的高水平专业精神和警惕性”，他在 Telegram 上写道。

;

;周六在俄罗斯社交媒体上流传的视频似乎显示大桥被烟雾笼罩。这些图像无法核实。

;

;俄罗斯化学油轮在乌克兰海上无人机袭击中受损

;

;乌克兰几乎从未公开声称对此类袭击负责，但表示摧毁俄罗斯的军事基础设施对其至关重要

;

;俄罗斯外交部发言人玛丽亚·扎哈罗娃 (Maria Zakharova) 谴责最近对该桥的袭击，称这些袭击对无辜生命和民用基础设施构成了威胁。

;

;“这种行为没有任何道理” ”她在 Telegram 上写道。

;

;另外，俄罗斯国防部表示，俄罗斯军队摧毁了周六早些时候发射到克里米亚半岛的 20 架乌克兰无人机。

;

;该部在 Telegram 上表示，无人机袭击没有造成人员伤亡和财产损失。据称，有 14 架无人机被防空系统摧毁，六架无人机被电子战压制。

;

;路透社无法独立核实该报道。目前尚不清楚这些报道中的袭击目标是什么。

;

;自 5 月初一架无人机在克里姆林宫上空被摧毁以来，对乌克兰俄罗斯控制领土和俄罗斯腹地的无人机袭击有所增加。

;

; >;

;去年 10 月，克里米亚大桥在一次强烈爆炸中遭到严重破坏，俄罗斯官员称，这是由一辆卡车在过桥时爆炸造成的，造成三人死亡。

;

;乌克兰 SBU 国内情报机构后来表示声称对此次破坏行动负责。

;

;这座桥是俄罗斯和半岛之间交通网络的唯一直接连接，是俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔·普京的旗舰项目，他为俄罗斯开放了道路交通。 2018 年，驾驶一辆卡车横渡大张旗鼓。

;

;周六，一架俄罗斯战机在执行训练任务时在俄罗斯加里宁格勒地区坠毁，机上两名飞行员丧生。

;

;“苏- 30架飞机在荒芜地区坠毁。这次飞行是在没有弹药的情况下进行的。当地军事当局表示：“船员死亡。”

;

;据官员称，事故原因可能是技术故障。

;

;加里宁格勒是波罗的海的俄罗斯飞地，位于北约成员国之间波兰和立陶宛。

;

;俄罗斯在乌克兰的行动中广泛使用了 Su-30 战斗机。

;

;俄罗斯空军遭受了一系列坠机事故，一些观察家将其归因于这些事故在乌克兰战事期间增加航班数量。上个月，两架俄罗斯战斗机在执行训练任务时坠毁，一架坠入太平洋，一架坠入亚速海。

;来自巴基斯坦人口最少省份的一位鲜为人知的参议员将担任看守总理反对派领导人周六表示，要带领国家度过下一次选举。

;

;来自俾路支省的 Anwaar-ul-Haq Kakar 在与即将卸任的总理会面后被反对派领导人拉贾·里亚兹·艾哈迈德 (Raja Riaz Ahmad) 任命谢巴兹·谢里夫。

;

;里亚兹说：“我们首先同意，无论谁担任总理，他都应该来自较小的省份，这样小省份的不满就应该得到解决。”

;

;卡卡尔将带领巴基斯坦参加定于 11 月举行的下一次大选和省级选举，但一些官员已经表示选举将推迟到明年。

;

;自前国际板球明星伊姆兰·汗 (Imran Khan) 上任以来，该国一直处于政治动荡之中。 2022 年 4 月，他因不信任投票而被解除总理职务，最终于上周末因腐败罪被判入狱三年。

;

;当局严厉打击了汗领导的巴基斯坦正义运动党 (PTI)近几个月来，围捕了数千名他的支持者和官员，镇压了他的草根权力。

;

;议会于周三正式解散，根据宪法，选举将在 90 天内举行。但几个月来一直有人猜测，随着当权者努力稳定一个面临重叠安全、经济和政治危机的国家，这些计划将被推迟。

;

;巴基斯坦前总理汗因非法出售国家被判入狱 3 年礼物

;

;最新人口普查的数据终于在上周末公布，即将卸任的政府表示，选举委员会需要时间重新划定选区边界。

;

;本周在电视上被问及投票是否会对于今年发生的事情，内政部长拉纳·萨纳拉 (Rana Sanaullah) 回答说：“绝对简单的答案——不。”选举委员会尚未发表评论。

;

;上个月，议会匆忙通过了一项立法，赋予看守政府更多权力与国际货币基金组织等全球机构进行谈判，这是它可能会存在一段时间的另一个线索。

;

;一些分析人士认为，这一推迟可能会给主要联盟伙伴 — — 巴基斯坦穆斯林联盟-纳瓦兹 (PML-N) 和巴基斯坦人民党 (PPP) — — 留出时间来弄清楚如何应对汗的挑战。 PTI。

;

;威尔逊南亚研究所所长迈克尔·库格曼 (Michael Kugelman) 表示：“但实际上，推迟选举只会进一步激怒公众，并激起已经遭受数月镇压的反对派。”中心。

;

;汗被赶下台后，花了几个月的时间通过一系列大规模集会和长征游行来激励他的支持者，其中包括他在一次暗杀行动中腿部中弹的一次。

;

;五月份被拘留三天后，汗的支持者走上街头，十多人在与警察的冲突中死亡。

;

;美国本周表示正在关注选举前景暴力。

;

;巴基斯坦的任何选举背后都潜伏着军队，自 1947 年印度分裂后组建国家以来，军队至少发动了三起成功的政变。

;

;汗享有真正的广泛支持他在 2018 年上台时得到了支持，但分析人士表示，这只是得到了该国有权势的将军们的支持——据报道，他在被罢黜前的几个月内与这些将军发生了争执。

;泰国五月选举中意外获胜的前进党陷入了两难境地在前盟友的总理候选人竞选被拒绝后，是支持还是反对该候选人。

;

;为泰党组建的新联盟计划提名房地产大亨 Srettha Thavisin 为总理它的总理人选。投票反对 Srettha 可能会将为泰党推向保守派对手和亲保皇党参议员，他们阻碍了“前进”组织在 Pita Limjaroenrat 领导下组建政府的努力。

;

;“前进”的立法者正在衡量其支持者的情绪——主要是城市和民众。年轻选民——决定其策略。 While Pita has said the party is in no hurry to decide, Piyabutr Saengkanokkul, a co-founder of disbanded predecessor Future Forward Party, said Move Forward should unequivocally state its resolve to sit in the opposition and rule out support for Pheu Thai's coalition.

;

;“Move Forward is likely to upset many of its supporters if they vote for a Pheu Thai premier candidate who will lead a reconciliation pact with conservatives,” said Peter Mumford, Southeast Asia practice head at consultancy Eurasia Group.

;

;'I won't drink it': how a Thai beverage became so politically polarising

;

;A policy paralysis has hurt investor confidence in Thailand, which has been under a caretaker government since March with no major powers. Political parties are now under pressure to end the post-election stalemate and tackle economic issues such as a fragile economic recovery, high household debt and dwindling disposable income.

;

;Move Forward was the front runner to run the government in the weeks after the May 14 election and now risks being relegated to the opposition, largely due to its unwillingness to back down from a pledge to amend royal insult laws and other platforms that may hurt pro-military business elites.

;

;Pheu Thai has made an outreach for support and calls for reconciliation among political parties, citing the best interests for the nation. Move Forward's decision could potentially determine the shape of Pheu Thai's coalition as pro-military parties and senators have yet to back the alliance.

;

;Pheu Thai's new alliance is well short of the majority in the two chambers of parliament, which together have 750 members and will decide who becomes the prime minister. The coalition had the support of 238 lawmakers as of Thursday, 13 short of the majority in the elected House of Representatives. Move Forward's 151 lawmakers can effectively seal Srettha's win even without the support of the senators or military-aligned groups.

;

;Pheu Thai, backed by former premier Thaksin Shinawatra's family, is pushing for what it calls a reconciliatory government with the support of parties from across the ideological divide. The party said it's time to put behind decades of colour-coded politics – red for Shinawatra supporters and yellow for their royalist opponents – and focus on measures to revive the economy.

;

;Thaksin's plan to return to Thailand from 15 years of self-imposed exile is also seen weighing on Pheu Thai's government formation. It potentially raises the necessity to broker deals with military-backed parties who represent the establishment to ensure his safe homecoming and the likelihood of receiving a royal pardon, said Napon Jatusripitak, a visiting fellow at the ISEAS-Yusof Ishak Institute.

;

;That too leaves Pheu Thai in a dilemma as it needs to decide if it should align with the military-affiliated parties despite having other options, Napon said.

;

;“Pheu Thai is not counting on Move Forward's support and seems to have ventured quite far down the 'dark side' already”, said Napon. “The actual challenge for Pheu Thai lies in the fact that certain options might significantly damage its reputation as a pro-democracy party, even if they lead it to power, or grant Thaksin a safe passage home”.

;

;Though Southeast Asia's second-largest economy is poised to expand more than 3% this year due to a rebound in tourism and private consumption, it faces headwinds from sluggish global demand for its goods and rising borrowing costs. Investors are also concerned the delay in forming a government may push back state budget approvals and public spending.

;

;Srettha sees the formation of a government at the earliest as a solution to urgent economic problems facing Thailand, and doesn't rule out an alliance with military-backed parties.

;

;“We need to be realistic”, he told reporters late on Friday. “We need a new government. To solve Thailand's problems, it's imperative that Pheu Thai leads the government”.

;

;For the first time, the academy will provide free public access to 100 patents spanning multiple AI application scenarios, including image processing, video technology and 3D visualisation, Damo said on its WeChat account on Friday.

;The initiative was intended to give small and medium-sized enterprises access to AI technology at a significantly lower cost amid rapid acceleration in technological development, Damo said.

;

;The licences will also be included in a national patent list published by the Intellectual Property Exchange Centre under the government of eastern Zhejiang province, where Alibaba's headquarters is based.

;The national patent scheme enlists dozens of universities and research institutions to provide access to more than 6,800 patents for smaller businesses paying an annual fee of 50,000 yuan or less, to boost technological innovation in the country, according to Chinese media reports.

;

;US President Joe Biden on Wednesday unveiled a long-anticipated executive order, putting new restrictions on investments that American firms can make in China in semiconductors and microelectronics, quantum information technologies, and AI systems.

;

;China leads the world in AI patent applications, with the country filing some 648,500 AI patent applications between 2018 and 2022, accounting for 62 per cent of the world's total, according to research and development analytics firm PatSnap.

;

;The US and South Korea followed in second and third place, with about 191,000 and 52,800 patent applications filed, respectively.

;

;Damo said three of the 100 free patents focused on precision treatment of cancer, which could help hospitals offer intelligent solutions and accelerate the transformation of technology used to cure the disease.

;

;Other patents include technology related to traffic signal perception used in intelligent traffic management, as well as image identification technology applicable to e-commerce platforms looking to weed out products that infringe on copyrights.

;

;The academy said it planned to free up more patents in the future to establish a “more open AI technology ecosystem”.

;

;Hangzhou-based Alibaba, owner of the South China Morning Post, established Damo in 2017 to focus on fundamental science and disruptive innovations. The institution has 16 laboratories covering areas ranging from AI and autonomous driving to quantum computing and semiconductor research and development.

;

;Alibaba's cloud unit in April revealed its own alternative to ChatGPT – Tongyi Qianwen – which was based on Damo's large language models (LLMs), making it one of the earliest Chinese companies to jump on the AI chatbot bandwagon.

;

;Last week, Alibaba's cloud computing unit open sourced two of its LLM models that were based on Tongyi Qianwen, in a move that analysts said was aimed at expanding the company's global influence in the field of AI.

;A local court in Shanghai reopened the divorce case and ordered the man, surnamed Zhou, to pay the damages he owed to his neighbour, surnamed Chen, Pear Video reported on July 8.

;Zhou accidentally hit Chen with his car while driving in their residential compound, which caused unspecified injuries and led to a dispute over the indemnity amount to be paid. When they failed to agree on the amount of compensation, Chen took the matter to a local court seeking damages.

;The court ruled Zhou should pay Chen 200,000 yuan to cover his medical expenses and disability compensation.

;

;However, Chen and the court soon discovered that Zhou had no assets listed in his name and seemed to have no way of paying the compensation.

;Suspicious of this, the court looked into Zhou's finances and transaction records for property and marriage. They discovered that Zhou divorced his wife just after the court ordered him to pay damages to Chen.

;It was revealed that Zhou had transferred two properties to his former wife, surnamed Tian, in their divorce settlement and made an agreement that neither was liable for the debts of the other, protecting the properties from being sold to pay Chen compensation.

;

;After learning of the deception, Chen requested the court withdraw the property settlement and demanded the divorced couple cover all costs incurred during the accident legal action.

;

;The court found that Zhou had transferred assets to avoid paying compensation and cancelled the property settlement made by the couple. Both were made to pay Chen's legal costs, and Zhou was ordered to pay the compensation he owed.

;

;Zhou's conduct has drawn widespread criticism on Chinese social media.

;

;One commenter remarked: “He is a selfish and heartless creature.”

;

;Another person asked: “This man scares me. Do others feel the same?”

;Stories about people taking extreme steps to get around the law are regularly in the news and a source of online debate in China.

;Last month, a local court in Beijing upheld a company's decision to dismiss an employee who concealed her pregnancy when she was hired to avoid discrimination.

;In September 2020, a man in eastern China divorced his wife and transferred his assets to her to avoid paying compensation of 150,000 yuan (US$20,700) to a woman injured at a child care centre he ran.
